data.title: War 'no obstacle' to ramping up relations
data.description: The war between  Ukraine  and  Russia  officially enters its 1,000th day on Tuesday, but despite the ongoing conflict, Kyiv remains committed to strengthening ties with countries in Southeast Asia to create new partnerships for mutual growth and secure additional assistance to end the war and get justice for its citizens.

data.title: PM urged to return land to monastery
data.description: Former senator Somchai Sawangkarn sent a third open letter to Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, urging her to expedite the return of a monastic plot of land acquired by Alpine Golf Course to Wat Thamikararam Worawihan, saying that the head of the government must perform her duties with honesty for the benefit of the country.

data.title: Key panel appointment for negotiation with Cambodia may face delay
data.description: The planned appointment of the Joint Technical Committee (JTC) to negotiate with  Cambodia  on the development of  disputed maritime areas  in the  Gulf of Thailand  might not be tabled for the cabinet

data.title: New booze control bill nearly ready
data.description: The chairman of the special committee scrutinising new alcohol control legislation, Wisarn Techathirawat, said the draft of the  Alcoholic Beverage Control  Bill was about 80% complete and would be submitted to parliament in mid-December.

data.title: Stimulus plan in the works
data.description: The Finance Ministry will on Tuesday present a comprehensive economic stimulus package to a related committee chaired by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for consideration, said Deputy Finance Minister Julapun Amornvivat.

data.title: Inquiry into Thailand's rising dugong death toll expanded
data.description: Another  dugong  was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the  alarming increase  in the dugong death rate.

data.title: Thailand to return rare animals to Madagascar
data.description: Thailand will return over 900  lemurs  and rare  turtles  seized from the illegal wildlife trade to  Madagascar  this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Singer quits Palang Pracharath Party amid extortion probe
data.description: Singer Rattapoom “Film” Tokongsup has resigned from the opposition Palang Pracharath Party (PPRP) amid a probe into alleged  extortion  related to  The iCon Group  case.

data.title: Inquiry into increasing dugong death expanded
data.description: Another dugong was found dead in Krabi on Sunday as the Natural Resources and Environment Minister Chalermchai Sri-on directed relevant authorities to expedite urgent measures concerning the alarming increase in the dugong death rate.

data.description: Thailand will return over 900 lemurs and rare turtles seized from the illegal wildlife trade to Madagascar this month, according to the Department of National Parks, Wildlife and Plant Conservation (DNP).

data.title: Grand parade for arrival of Lord Buddha’s tooth
data.description: The government will organise a grand parade for the arrival of Lord Buddha

data.title: Inspection deadline looms for gas-powered tour buses
data.description: The Department of Land Transport has warned the operators of almost 6,000 natural gas-powered (CNG) buses they must present their vehicles for safety inspection  before Nov 30 or be put off the road.

data.title: Phuket hails off-season tourist boom
data.description: Phuket

data.title: Scams lead to B718m in losses
data.description: Fraudulent accounts on Facebook caused 718 million baht in damages in the past year, says Digital Economy and Society Minister Prasert Jantararuangtong.

data.title: Govt speeds up rights boost
data.description: The Labour Ministry is speeding up its changes to the Labour Relations Act and the State Enterprise Labor Relations Act to ensure basic labour rights in the country meet international standards, says spokesman Phumipat Mueanchan.

data.title: Dept warns of dubious job offers on social media sites
data.description: The Department of Employment (DoE) warns job seekers that scammers are using social media to trick people into sending money for non-existent jobs in Australia.

data.description: Airports of Thailand (AoT) will push Thai airports to join the ranks of the world

data.title: Airlines to add 73,000 seats over NY
data.description: Six airlines have agreed to add over 73,000 seats over the  New Year  period to ensure prices don

data.title: Monkeys escape cage, invade police station in Thailand's Lop Buri
data.description: LOP BURI: More than 200 monkeys escaped from their cage at the Lop Buri municipality’s Pho Khao Ton Monkey Nursery in Muang district and invaded Tha Hin police station.

data.title: Havoc as caged monkeys escape
data.description: LOP BURI: More than 200 monkeys escaped from their cage at the Lop Buri municipality’s Pho Khao Ton Monkey Nursery in Muang district and invaded Tha Hin police station.

data.title: Thai corrections officials assure proper care of detained Malaysian singer
data.description: The Corrections Department has assured that measures are in place for  Muslim inmates  at Thai prisons to be able to follow their religious restrictions and rules after the detainment of a well-known Malaysian  pop singer  at the Narathiwat Provincial Prison  in a  drug arrest  early this month.

data.title: Alleged extortionist denies charges in iCon Group direct sales saga
data.description: A woman denied all charges and remained tight-lipped after hours of questioning over alleged extortion in The iCon Group direct sales saga, according to police.

data.title: Russian woman passenger punched by Bolt rider in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA: A Russian woman was assaulted by a Bolt motorcycle taxi driver after she told him to reduce speed in fear of accident.

data.title: Miss Thailand is Miss Universe 3rd runner-up
data.description: Miss Universe Thailand became the third runner-up in the Miss Universe pageant held in Mexico City on Sunday morning, Thailand time.

data.title: Most Thais clueless about MoU 44, Koh Kut dispute with Cambodia: poll
data.description: The vast majority of Thais have no clue nor want to understand the controversy surrounding MoU 44 and the Koh Kut border issue with Cambodia, while those understanding the matter have zero trust that the government would be able to protect the national interest, a public opinion survey showed.

data.title: Education minister hails Thailand's free lunch programme
data.description: The education ministry has given assurances that  students  will receive proper  meals  under next year

data.title: Thailand climbs to 41st place in Global Innovation Index
data.description: Thailand was ranked 41 among 133 economies featured in the  Global Innovation Index  (GII) 2024, its highest place in a decade, the National Innovation Agency (NIA) has said.

data.title: Plastic surgery ad screening stepped up
data.description: The Department of Health Service Support (DHSS) is screening online ads and promotions published by so-called beauty agencies and gurus about plastic surgery services.

data.title: Ministry seeks to boost research standards
data.description: The Ministry of Higher Education, Science, Research and Innovation (MHESI) wants the country to be among the top 10 in the world for scientific analysis and research by 2029.

data.title: Manners first; arrest gripe; hole in the heart; price shock
data.description: A well-mannered gold thief in Samut Sakhon took his shoes off outside the shop because a sign told him to do so.
